multiplechoiceresponse.p:
Examine this argument:
Few cats are orange colored. I hear a cat meowing across the street. The cat meowing is probably not orange.
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Does this inductive argument seem to be strong or weak?

div.p: Without any further information, assuming a particular thing is a member of the largest population of that thing (the cat is a member of the class of cats that are not orange given that it's much bigger than the class of cats that are orange) typically is a safe bet.
